alert.note: Alert for Dauphin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:08PM EST until further notice by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek above Middletown affecting Dauphin County. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt will contribute to rising river levels along Swatara Creek through Thursday. Additional rainfall Friday into Saturday will result in additional rises through the weekend. For the Swatara Creek...including Middletown, Harper Tavern, Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek above Middletown. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding begins near the Vine Street Bridge downstream to the Susquehanna River. At 12.0 feet, Both banks overflow upstream of the Vine Street Bridge and several basements are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 11.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon to 10.4 feet early Saturday morning. It will then rise above flood stage again late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
